title: Point Style Of GGplot — formatPointsOfGGplot
text: plot (ggplot) data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). pointStyle (list) named list style definitions, output plotPointsServer ... arguments passed layer()'s params argument. arguments broadly fall one 4 categories . Notably, arguments position argument, aesthetics required can passed .... Unknown arguments part 4 categories ignored. Static aesthetics mapped scale, fixed value apply layer whole. example, colour = "red" linewidth = 3. geom's documentation Aesthetics section lists available options. 'required' aesthetics passed params. Please note passing unmapped aesthetics vectors technically possible, order required length guaranteed parallel input data. constructing layer using stat_*() function, ... argument can used pass parameters geom part layer. example stat_density(geom = "area", outline.type = ""). geom's documentation lists parameters can accept. Inversely, constructing layer using geom_*() function, ... argument can used pass parameters stat part layer. example geom_area(stat = "density", adjust = 0.5). stat's documentation lists parameters can accept. key_glyph argument layer() may also passed .... can one functions described key glyphs, change display layer legend.

title: Server function for plot export — plotExportServer
code: plotExportServer(   id,   plotFun,   plotType = c("none", "ggplot", "ggplot_only_titles"),   filename = sprintf("%s_plot", gsub("-", "", Sys.Date())),   plotly = FALSE,   plotWidth = reactive(1280),   plotHeight = reactive(800),   initText = NULL,   initRanges = NULL )

title: Server function for plot export — plotExportServer
text: id namespace id plotFun (reactive) reactive function returning plot export plotType (character) one "none", "ggplot", "ggplot_only_titles". Adds option format titles ranges plot within export UI (currently ggplots). plotType == "ggplot_only_titles" titles can adjusted. prevents custom formatting axis ranges might overwritten formatScalesOfGGplot(). filename (character) name file without file extension plotly (logical) set TRUE plotFun returns plotly output plotWidth (reactive) default plot width plotHeight (reactive) default plot height initText (list) optional, named list title definitions, output plotTitlesServer initRanges (list) optional, named list range definitions, output plotRangesServer

title: Plot Legend UI — plotLegendUI
text: id namespace id title (character) module title titleTag (character) HTML tag put around title, e.g. "h4" h4 htmltools type character. Type plot. Default "ggplot". width character. Width input. legend_title reactive. Default title legend. legend_labels reactive. Default labels legend. plot_type character. Type plot. Default "ggplot".

title: Shiny Try Catch — shinyTryCatch
text: Catch multiple errors warnings, forward alert. error occurs, NULL returned. warning occurs, result returned. Please, add shinyjs::useShinyjs() UI enable alerts.

title: Shiny Try Catch — shinyTryCatch
code: shinyTryCatch(   expr,   errorTitle = "Modeling failed",   warningTitle = "",   alertStyle = "shinyjs",   inShiny = TRUE,   suppressWarnings = FALSE )

title: Shiny Try Catch — shinyTryCatch
text: expr expression evaluated. errorTitle (character) error message title. warningTitle (character) warning message title. alertStyle (character) Either "shinyjs", "shinyalert". Specifies error warning given . "shinyjs" shinyjs::alert used; "shinyalert" shinyalert::shinyalert used. inShiny (logical) FALSE prevents alert shiny, instead warning displayed. Use applied within Shiny session. suppressWarnings (logical) TRUE, warnings suppressed given alert.
